Description: Gold amulet in the shape of a flat wedjat-eye, pierced lengthwise, made of two folded metal foils, sligthly embossed and welded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Probably from the North-west Ptolemaic mound or from the desert surface around the site.
Curator's comments: One of the gold "symbolic eyes" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 30. See also London, BM, EA 18251 and Boston, MFA 87.76.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 30)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.59, p.179, pl.21)
